org.richfaces.fragment.hotkey

Class RichFacesHotkey

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.richfaces.fragment.hotkey.RichFacesHotkey
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdvancedInteractions<RichFacesHotkey.AdvancedHotkeyInteractions>, Hotkey

    public class RichFacesHotkey
extends Object
implements Hotkey, AdvancedInteractions<RichFacesHotkey.AdvancedHotkeyInteractions>
    Automatically set hotkey from widget, if no hotkey from user is set.

      protected org.openqa.selenium.interactions.Actions getActions() 
      void invoke()
      Invokes the hotkey on an element which is specified by selector attribute of hotkey, when the selector is empty, then the hotkey will be invoked on body element.

      • invoke

        public void invoke()
        Description copied from interface: Hotkey
        Invokes the hotkey on an element which is specified by selector attribute of hotkey, when the selector is empty, then the hotkey will be invoked on body element.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface Hotkey
        See Also:
        Hotkey.setHotkey(java.lang.String), Hotkey.setSelector(java.lang.String)

      • invoke

        public void invoke(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement elementOrNull)
        Description copied from interface: Hotkey
        Invokes the hotkey on a specified element.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface Hotkey
        Parameters:
        elementOrNull - element on which the hotkey will be invoked. In case the element is null, the actually focused element is used, otherwise the body element is used.
        See Also:
        Hotkey.setHotkey(java.lang.String)

      • setHotkey

        public void setHotkey(String hotkey)
        Description copied from interface: Hotkey
        Sets the hotkey which will be invoked
        Specified by:
        setHotkey in interface Hotkey
        Parameters:
        hotkey - key sequence which will be invoked, keys are separated with '+' sign and are in lowercase. For example: 'alt+x'.

      • setSelector

        public void setSelector(String selector)
        Description copied from interface: Hotkey
        Sets the JQuery selector, by which the element on which the hotkey will be invoked, will be found.
        Specified by:
        setSelector in interface Hotkey
        Parameters:
        selector - JQuery selector to locate element on which the hotkey will be applied
